intro: Psychotria sitae subsp. holochlora, commonly known as the red-eyed beauty, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in tropical regions. The plant is characterized by its striking, dark red flowers with contrasting yellow stamens, which make it visually distinctive. It typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. The leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, with a glossy surface and a strong, aromatic scent.
